reference.shortdesc: The media source specifies the location of an audio or video resource.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The media source is modeled on the source element used in HTML5 media elements.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: When multiple media-source elements are present, the user agent evaluates them in document order and selects the first resource that can be played.
When multiple media-source components are present, the user agent evaluates them in document order and selects the first resource that can be played.

dlentry.dd: Specifies the format of the resource being addressed.
Specifies the URI of the media resource.
Specifies a key reference to the media resource.

The scope attribute describes the closeness of the relationship between the current document and the target resource. Resources in the same information unit are considered "local"; resources in the same system as the referencing content but not part of the same information unit are considered "peer"; and resources outside the system, such as Web pages, are considered "external".
